column4: Hi I have two installations of ubuntu of two seperate drives but I want to mount one of the drives in the other so that I can transfer data onto one drive and format the other. I have the drive that I want to mount plugged in as slave on secondary ide and ubuntu recognises the disk as hdd but I cannot access the drive. How does one do this??
the BIOS sees the drives OK?
yes
dmesg | less to find the device names of the drives.  create a directory /mnt and mount that sucker on it.
i thought it would be too...   check your media:/ folder.  see if it's there
nope not there will try the mount option though
mount will certainly work
it's just not as automagic as it should be.
that's definitely something to add to Ubuntu eh?   Auto HD mounting to the /mnt folder or something.
dmesg |less gave me a whole lota this "Buffer I/O error on device hdd, logical block 0
is the drive failing?
cool...   'apt-get install gnome-volume-manager'
preface that with 'sudo'
I've got the latest version already installed
it was from another ubuntu install?
yes
try -t ext3
and before you complete the whole project, be sure to look over the man page and get familiar with the other options of 'mount'
...willis.
did that work for you?
nope I'm going to shut down now and reverse the drives and see if it picks it up on the other install/drive
you didn't alter the default install file system type?

hi again, do you think that fstab having the wrong listings would be a problem i.e. the dvd drive is listed in fstab as /dev/hdb yet the harddrive I want mounted in system/administration/Disks is listed as /dev/hdb
